total_revenue.notes: Cloud and AI strength fuels record quarter

highlights: Microsoft 365 Commercial products +16% (15% CC) with cloud revenue +18% (16% CC)
Dynamics products +18% (17% CC) with Dynamics 365 +23% (21% CC)
Server products and cloud services +27% (24% CC)
Azure and other cloud services +39% (35% CC) dominated by Azure growth across workloads
Search and news advertising ex-TAC +21% (20% CC)

Azure.notes: Growth driven by contributions across all workloads

capital_expenditures.notes: Includes $6.5B of finance leases recorded at lease commencement; roughly half long-lived assets and half servers/GPUs.

infrastructure: Opened new data centers across six continents, standing up over 2GW of capacity and scaling to 400 data centers in 70 regions; every region is AI-first with liquid cooling.
data_ai: Microsoft Fabric revenue +55% YoY with 25,000+ customers, Fabric OneLake spans multi-cloud semantic lakes; Foundry processed 500T tokens and is used by 14,000 customers for agents.
copilot_and_agents: Copilot apps now 100M MAUs, 800M AI feature users; introduced combined chat/search/notebooks/agents update, saw record seat adds and 3M agents created this year.
GitHub Copilot users reached 20M with Agent Mode and async coding agents; 90% of Fortune 100 use Copilot and AI repos more than doubled.
security_gaming_linkedin: Security Copilot agents leverage SIEM improvements, Entra secures agent permissions, Defender secures 2M AI apps, and Purview protects Copilot data with 1.5M security customers.

LinkedIn hit 1.2B members with accelerating engagement and AI hiring tools; Gaming reached 500M MAUs, 50M players for Black Ops 6, 5B Game Pass revenue, 150M+ cloud gaming hours, and new Copilot for Gaming assistants.

full_year_fy26.revenue_growth: Another year of double-digit revenue and operating income growth
full_year_fy26.capex: Growth moderates with higher mix of short-lived assets; H1 growth higher due to finance-lease sites; FX expected to add ~2 points to revenue and COGS growth

revenue_growth.value: 32.2-32.5B total; +14-15% CC with 3 pts FX lift
revenue_growth.m365: Commercial cloud +13-14% CC; consumer cloud low 20s

intelligent_cloud.azure_growth: +37% CC with capacity timing and supply constraints

more_personal_computing.value: 12.4-12.9B; Windows OEM/devices down mid-to-high single digits; search revenue low-double digits; gaming revenue decline mid-to-high single digits

q1_guidance.capex: >$30B driven by delivery timing and finance leases

metadata.source: Microsoft FY 2025 Q4 earnings release and transcript
